New Records: Rachin Ravindra became the youngest New Zealand player to score a World Cup century at 23 years old.
Devon Conway scored a career-best 152* in the match.
Key Match Events: New Zealand won the match by 9 wickets with 82 balls remaining.
Sam Curran dismissed Will Young for a duck with his first ball of the innings.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and elected to field first.
England's players discussed their need to adapt their attacking style to suit the Indian conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler, England's captain, expressed disappointment but remained positive about the team's performance.
Tom Latham, New Zealand's captain, praised the partnership between Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under lights at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
Rachin Ravindra was named Player of the Match for his impressive performance.
Others: The match was the opening game of the 2023-24 ICC Cricket World Cup.
